thread.title: H-E-B sets closing date for Bellaire store to build multilevel location - Houston Business Journal
thread.title_full: H-E-B sets closing date for Bellaire store to build multilevel location - Houston Business Journal

author: Olivia Pulsinelli
title: H-E-B sets closing date for Bellaire store to build multilevel location - Houston Business Journal
text: Scott McClelland, Houston division president of HEB. Eric Kayne San Antonio-based H-E-B Grocery Co. will close its Bellaire store next month to begin the construction process for its new store on the same site. The store, at 5130 Cedar, will close March 13, and construction will begin March 17, according to Realty News Report . The new store is expected to open in the fall, but there is no definite date, Cyndy Garza Roberts , H-E-B’s director of public affairs, told RNR. Scott McClelland, Houston division president of HEB. Eric Kayne That aligns with the general timeline H-E-B released nearly a year ago . H-E-B will demolish its entire strip center, which used to house Hong Kong Chef and other small tenants, to build the new store and two-level parking garage. According to RNR and plans posted on Swamplot in August, the ground level will consist entirely of parking. The upper parking deck will house the store and open-air parking. The lower level will offer 230 garage spaces, plus five on the street, while the upper level will only have 82 spots, according to RNR. The current store opened in 1994 and is about 20,000 square feet. The new 70,000-square-foot store will include a 52,833-square-foot sales floor, a 2,098-square-foot pharmacy, 2,064 square feet for food prep and a 2,319-square-foot administrative mezzanine, according to RNR. H-E-B’s internal design and construction team is designing the store, and RNR reports that Terra Associates Inc. is the consulting engineering firm on the project. Meanwhile, demolition also appears to be looming at the site of another urban H-E-B. Swamplot posted photos Feb. 6 of construction preparation work at Memorial Heights Apartments. That’s the future home of Buffalo Heights, the first phase of which will consist of a 4-acre, mixed-use development at the corner of Washington Avenue and South Heights Boulevard . H-E-B will open a 96,000-square-foot store as the anchor tenant for that phase, which will also offer multilevel parking. Houston-based Midway Cos. is developing Buffalo Heights for Houston-based BKR Memorial II LLC, a private company owned by the Russell and Glenda Gordy family. H-E-B also is interested in opening a multilevel location at the site of a former Fiesta Mart on North Shepherd Drive, especially now that the Heights is loosening its dry zone rules . Olivia Pulsinelli is the senior web editor for the Houston Business Journal's award-winning website. Follow her on Twitter for more . Bizspace Spotlight
